title: Wisdom and Righteousness
shortSummary: Proverbs Chapter 10 contrasts the outcomes of wisdom and folly, righteousness and wickedness, highlighting the blessings that come from living a godly life. This chapter emphasizes practical wisdom for daily living, showing how integrity, diligence, and fear of the Lord lead to life and prosperity, while wickedness results in ruin and shame.

keyCharacters.name: Solomon
keyCharacters.description: The wise king of Israel traditionally credited with authoring the proverbs, providing divine wisdom for righteous living.

keyCharacters.name: Wise Son
keyCharacters.description: A representative figure symbolizing those who embrace wisdom and bring joy and honor to their parents.

keyCharacters.name: Foolish Son
keyCharacters.description: A figure representing those who reject wisdom, causing grief and shame to their family.

definitions.definition: A lazy or careless attitude toward work, leading to poverty or lack.
One who talks excessively without wisdom, often leading to downfall.
A reverent awe and respect for God that leads to obedience and wisdom.
A symbol of discipline and correction used to guide the foolish toward understanding.

outline.heading: The Contrast Between Wise and Foolish Children
outline.description: This section introduces the theme of wisdom versus folly, showing how wise children bring joy and diligence leads to prosperity, while foolishness brings shame and poverty.

outline.heading: Blessings of the Righteous Versus the Wicked
outline.description: These verses contrast the blessings, honor, and protection granted to the righteous with the destruction and shame that accompany wickedness.

outline.heading: The Power of Words and Wisdom
outline.description: This section highlights the importance of wise speech and understanding, showing how the righteous use words to bring life and instruction, while fools bring ruin.

outline.heading: The Outcomes of Righteousness and Wickedness
outline.description: The final section emphasizes the lasting security and blessings of the righteous contrasted with the fleeting and destructive end of the wicked, encouraging adherence to God's ways.

application: Pursue diligence and hard work as a reflection of godly wisdom to experience God's blessings in your life.
Guard your speech carefully, using words to build up others and avoid the pitfalls of foolish talk.
Embrace correction and instruction as pathways to life and avoid the ruin that comes from rejecting wisdom.
Cultivate a reverent fear of the Lord, knowing it leads to longevity, blessing, and a firm foundation.

keyVerses.text: The blessing of the LORD, it maketh rich, and he addeth no sorrow with it.
keyVerses.significance: This verse underscores that true prosperity comes from God's blessing, which brings no regret or trouble.

keyVerses.text: The proverbs of Solomon. A wise son maketh a glad father: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.
keyVerses.significance: It sets the tone for the chapter by contrasting the joy and grief that wisdom and folly bring to families.

keyVerses.text: The fear of the LORD prolongeth days: but the years of the wicked shall be shortened.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the life-giving power of reverence for God compared to the destructive consequences of wickedness.
